Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.flow

Class Round

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.flow.Round
public final class Round extends Object

Class representing a round.

In charge of initializing the round and starting new turns while the end-of-round-conditions are not met.

Instantiated by Tabletop. Only one instance is supposed to be active at a given time.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Round

      public Round()

      The constructor does it all : initialize the round and play turns until one only player's identity is unrevealed.

      The first player to play is chosen randomly the first time. For all other rounds (except when the game is tied), the last unrevealed player is chosen to start.

      At the start of a round, every player chooses their identity and their hand is distributed.

      The round will keep creating turns played by the next player until it detects only one player's identity has not been revealed.

      By default, the next player is the one standing to the left of the current player (clockwise). Cards and accusations change it.

      The score counter will save the score obtained at the end of each round for each player.

      At the end of the round, the score board is displayed and every Rumour Card of the pile is returned to Tabletop's list of existing cards. Afterwise, the object's life ends and it is ready to get collected by the GC.

  • Method Details

    • distributeIdentity

      private void distributeIdentity()
      Requests each player of the round to choose their identity.
      See Also:
      • Player
      • Identity
      • Player::chooseIdentity()

    • distributeHand

      private void distributeHand()

      Distribute their hand to each of the round's players.

      Each player gets a number of cards equal to the existing Rumour Cards number's quotient in the division by the number of players.

      If the division has a remainder, the cards that weren't distributed are placed in the pile.

    • isOver

      private boolean isOver()

      Checks whether the end-of-round conditions are met or not

      The round is over when there is only one last unrevealed player remaining.

      Returns:
      checkLastUnrevealedPlayer()

    • checkLastUnrevealedPlayer

      public boolean checkLastUnrevealedPlayer()

      Checks whether there is only one unrevealed player left or more

      The last unrevealed player will be notified and therefore update their score) depending on their identity.

      Returns:
      true if it is the case, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Player::winRound()
      • Tabletop.getUnrevealedPlayersList()
